page.title: 08THE BRANSCOMBE VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The village hall was rebuilt in 1976 out of stone, it was finished in December. Originally it was made out of wood. The money to build the village hall came from loans, grants, fund raising and donations. The people who use the village hall are organisations and groups. About 13 groups use the village hall. It is busier in summer than winter. The hall is used often 7 days a week. It has changded in 20 years because it used to be a gloryfied wooden hut. The car park and playing field has been there six years they were given by some people called the Hibberts. There is a slide, some swings, a rocking horse, football pitch, a tennis court and a netball court. As well there is a river running around it also there is a small water fall.
